text:
A bullish setup for me is when the 9-day EMA is above the 21-day EMA & the stock is holding both the 50-day & 200-day SMA so both momentum + structure are moving in the same direction.

If the only level a stock is holding is the 200-day SMA then the long-term trend is still intact but the momentum has faded so I treat it as a hold.

When the price breaks below all three levels then that is when I consider the trend bearish because the short-term, intermediate & long-term signals are all pointing the same way.

KEY LEVELS TO WATCH FOR THE FINTWIT FAVORITES

Bullish | $NVDA, $TSLA, $PLTR, $RKLB, $ASTS

Hold | $AMD, $IREN, $CIFR, $OPEN, $NBIS, $OKLO, $IONQ, $HOOD, $SOFI, $EOSE

Bearish | $ACHR, $OSCR, $HIMS, $TEM

$AAPL Services now generates ~$300M per day.

This is recurring, digital, high-margin revenue layered on top of Apple‚Äôs ~2B active devices.

The iPhone, iPad, Mac & wearables create the user but Services compound the lifetime value.

I‚Äôve covered many of these names in depth on the Futurum Equities podcast.

piped.video/@FuturumEquities

5 STOCKS BUILDING THE INFRASTRUCTURE OF TOMORROW

1. $OKLO building the ‚Äúlocal nuclear plant‚Äù for the AI economy
2. $ASTS building the communications layer that monetizes space-based connectivity
3. $ONDS secure communication networks for autonomous drones & rail systems
4. $RKLB building the future of space logistics through integrated launch & in-orbit services
5. $IONQ positioning quantum as the overflow layer once classical compute hits physical limit

Peter Lynch said it best.

People lose more money by waiting for the ‚Äúperfect‚Äù pullback that never comes than they do in the actual downturns.

$META is one of my top 2026 names because it controls more human attention than anyone and is now layering AI directly into ads, feeds & discovery where monetization already exists.
If you invested $10K in $NVDA a decade ago, you would have $2.4M  üò≥

2026 will be the year AI economics shift away from ‚Äúwho has the smartest model‚Äù toward ‚Äúwho owns the surface where AI is used.‚Äù

Platforms with built-in distribution win because they monetize engagement, data & workflows. 

I dug into the names best positioned for this shift on the latest Futurum Equities podcast.

Morgan Stanley is emerging as the favorite to lead the SpaceX IPO which is shaping up to be the most important listing of the decade.

If SpaceX debuts at premium multiples (65x 2026 price-to-sales) then the companies supplying components, building satellites or competing in adjacent segments will be re-rated upward simply because the benchmark has moved.

$RKLB, $ASTS, $PL, $RDW, $FLY, $FJET, $BKSY, $LUNR

The world‚Äôs most valuable assets are no longer commodities you extract once and store forever but AI platforms that continuously learn, adapt & monetize usage at scale.

‚Ä¢ $META uses AI to keep people engaged longer & sell better ads.
‚Ä¢ $NVDA makes money every time AI runs because all AI needs its chips.
‚Ä¢ $TSLA improves its software by learning from millions of cars in the real world.
‚Ä¢ $AMZN sells AI like electricity by renting the infrastructure behind it.
‚Ä¢ $MSFT monetizes AI through enterprise lock-in by embedding intelligence directly into workflows.
‚Ä¢ $GOOGL compounds intelligence by vertically integrating chips, models, distribution & advertising into a closed monetization loop.

5 BIGGEST WINNERS FROM $NVDA + GROQ DEAL

1. $MSFT & $AMZN benefit because AI inference stays anchored to a unified Nvidia platform making it easier to deploy & scale AI services without managing fragmented hardware stacks.

2. $AVGO & $ALAB win as real-time AI increases the amount of data moving between chips, servers & racks which raises demand for networking, interconnects & connectivity hardware.

3. $ASML benefits because more AI pathways mean more total chips being built reinforcing its role as the critical supplier for advanced semiconductor manufacturing.

4. $VST gains as deterministic inference pushes AI toward always-on, real-time usage, raising data center utilization & power intensity.

5. $PLTR, $SNOW & $MDB benefit as cheaper/more predictable inference increases AI usage inside live applications driving higher query frequency & deeper integration into production workflows.
